content.2: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct
content.4: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
content.5: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.
content.7: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
content.8: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
content.9: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
content.11: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one
content.13: Hide them in the dust together;
content.14: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
content.15: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
content.17: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
content.20: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
content.21: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
content.23: Behold, he drinketh up a river,
content.24: He taketh it with his eyes:
